TopicTitle: Naming the Stars of KSP, and more!

Articles.Content:
I looked at the kSP constellation's thread, and realized there is no thread for this. What can done in this thread:

  • Name stars you see in KSP

  • Theorize about those stars you found. Do they have planets orbiting them? Is one of those planets habitable?

  • Make zoom-ins of the stars

  • Make drawings of the star, and if it is a solar system, draw a picture of the solar system

Have fun!

Edited June 3, 2013 by ShachonianX
I will take part in this endeavor. Soon.

We need Star Mappers.

-initiating the Kerbal Space Program Star Mapping Initiative-

Here's my contribution. Those two gas giants might have some interesting moons too!

Also, those gas giants must be HUGE to be seen next to their star, and the star must be very close for us to be able to see those gas giants.

Here are some of my stars that I have named.

Because of how close the Korexor stars are to each other, they could be the suns of a trinary system.
The galaxy that you sometimes see is the Hawking Galaxy and is known to have many black holes in it.
